channel.title: Getting Started on Econumo
channel.description: Recent content in Getting Started on Econumo

item.title: FAQ
item.description: Frequently Asked Questions # Do you have plans to add automated import of transactions from banks? # Automated import of transactions from banks and other sources is not a priority for me. I prefer to enter transactions manually, as it helps me to be more aware of my expenses. It might be added in the future as an optional feature, but it will not be the main focus of the application.

item.title: Open Source
item.description: Open Source # Econumo consists of two parts: Frontend and Backend. Backend # Backend is open-source under the AGPLv3 license and can be found on Github. It is written in PHP and uses the Symfony framework. The docker image is available on Docker Hub. Frontend # Frontend is not open-source, but it is available for self-hosting. You can find the docker image on Docker Hub. Installation # You need to have Docker and Docker Compose installed on your machine to run Econumo.
